article.headline: New Orleans 77, Ark.-Little Rock 75
article.story: LITTLE ROCK, Ark. (AP) -- Kechan Myers sunk a free throw with 1.3 seconds remaining to lead New Orleans to a 77-75 win over Arkansas-Little Rock Saturday night. The Privateers (17-9, 7-7 Sun Belt Conference) trailed Arkansas State 38-32 at the half. But New Orleans out-shot the Trojans 52 percent to 28 percent in the second half to come away with the win. Bo McCalebb finished with 30 points to lead the Privateers. It's the fourth time in five games that McCalebb has scored 30 points or more. Kyndall Dykes and Myers each had 15 points for the Privateers. Mike Smith led the Trojans (15-10, 7-7) with 24 points and 10 rebounds. Steven Moore added 22 for Arkansas-Little Rock.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
